1: He said to me, “Son of man,[a] stand on your feet and I will speak with you.”
2: As he spoke to me,[b] a wind[c] came into me and stood me on my feet, and I heard the one speaking to me.
3: He said to me, “Son of man, I am sending you to the house[d] of Israel, to rebellious nations[e] who have rebelled against me; both they and their fathers have revolted[f] against me to this very day.
4: The people[g] to whom I am sending you are obstinate and hard-hearted,[h] and you must say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says.'[i]
5: And as for them,[j] whether they listen[k] or not—for they are a rebellious[l] house[m]—they will know that a prophet has been among them.
6: But you, son of man, do not fear them, and do not fear their words. Even though briers[n] and thorns[o] surround you and you live among scorpions—do not fear their words and do not be terrified of the looks they give you,[p] for they are a rebellious house!
7: You must speak my words to them whether they listen or not, for they are rebellious.
8: As for you, son of man, listen to what I am saying to you: Do not rebel like that rebellious house! Open your mouth and eat what I am giving you.”
9: Then I looked and realized a hand was stretched out to me, and in it was a written scroll.
10: He unrolled it before me, and it had writing on the front[q] and back;[r] written on it were laments, mourning, and woe.
